#Text=Make a Marble Rollercoaster
#Text=Here 's a fun way to make a marble roller coaster that tests your skills of construction .
#Text=( If you do make one of these , how about registering so you can share some photos of it with other readers of wikiHow ?
#Text=Then , just click the " Edit " tab , and look for and click the " picture " icon right above the edit box and located next to the " Web " icon .
#Text=When the images window opens click " Browse " to upload by browsing to your pictures saved on your computer and clicking to add them ! )
#Text=Steps

#Text=Save up odds and ends that can be used such as empty cardboard tubes from paper towels , toilet paper , food wrap and foil to attach ( i.e. : tape ) together later to form a tube for a tunnel for the marbles to pass through .
#Text=See whether your parents or a neighbor has an old 3/4 inch diameter ( 19mm ) water hose to make tunnels -- but hoses that are 1/2 inch ( 13mm ) or 5/8 inch ( 16mm ) are not large enough .
#Text=Use pieces of PVC pipe or tubing for tunnels .
#Text=Make troughs ( open channels ) of cardboard or such to connect tubing at places to be able to see the progress of the marble passing through there .
#Text=Try splitting open foam pipe which is malleable and should enable you to make troughs and bend it to make arches , curves , and up and down areas .
#Text=Make hills and jumps/drop-offs for the marbles .
#Text=Look at how to make a Rube-Goldberg machine for ideas .
#Text=Use a plastic bottle(s) to make a funnel ( s ) to receive the jumping , running or falling marble and guide it into the next tunnel ( or alternative course ) .
#Text=Possibly you can put 2 or 3 bottles together so each one goes to a different/alternative tunnel .
#Text=Experiment with pieces of plastic pipe , and plastic pipe elbows or such pieces to make joints and turns between the tubing .
#Text=Plan how to create a long enough tunnel system , and temporarily attach it to something high , such as the back of a chair or couch , a mantelpiece , or other furniture that appears suitable .
#Text=Go outdoors , if you have a suitable area and attach this to a tree or fence .
#Text=Or , make a semi-permanent structure from wood or cardboard to serve as the " base " for your rollercoaster .
#Text=Use tape , string , sisal , raffia , etc. as means of attaching .
#Text=Be sure to not damage any furniture using the attaching item .
#Text=Glue should not be used unless the item is to be a permanent structure just for your marble rollercoaster .
#Text=Test roll some marbles .
#Text=See how they roll .
#Text=You will need to make adjustments where the marbles do not roll effectively .
#Text=Keep fiddling with it until the tunnel and trough ( channel ) system works ; this is a good creative exercise to test out your engineering skills .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=Have a good storage area for the tunnel structure so that it does n't get squashed or damaged when not in use .
#Text=If your roller coaster does not work at first , keep on trying by changing angles , shapes , twists etc. until everything works well .
#Text=Add loops
#Text=jumps or anything else to make your roller coaster more exciting to observe .
#Text=Build on it over time .
#Text=Make sure your marble rollercoaster is durable so it does n't keep breaking .
#Text=Things
#Text=You 'll Need
#Text=Marbles
#Text=Toilet paper
#Text=tubes
#Text=3/4 in water hose ( optional )
#Text=PVC pipe and elbows ( optional )
#Text=Foam piping pieces ( optional )
